intro: Icacorea denticulata, commonly known as the narrow-leaved hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its hairy, ovate leaves and showy, five-petaled flowers. The plant typically grows in coastal and sandy soils, thriving in well-drained environments. Its flowers, which range in color from white to pink, bloom throughout the year, attracting pollinators such as bees and birds. Icacorea denticulata is often used in gardens for its ornamental value and is relatively low maintenance.
